children.structure_process: 1. Screening → 2. Scoping → 3. Baseline Data Collection → 4. Impact Prediction → 5. Mitigation → 6. Reporting → 7. Review → 8. Decision-Making → 9. Monitoring and Compliance

children.examples: Construction of hydroelectric dam, Expansion of an airport, Urban waste treatment facility

children.terminology: 1. Screening → Determining whether a project requires an EIA
2. Scoping → Identifying key environmental issues and study boundaries
3. Baseline Data Collection → Gathering environmental conditions before the project
4. Impact Prediction → Forecasting potential environmental changes
5. Mitigation → Proposing ways to avoid, minimize, or offset impacts
6. Reporting → Compiling findings into an Environmental Impact Statement (EIS)
7. Review → Evaluating the quality and adequacy of the EIS
8. Decision-Making → Approving, modifying, or rejecting the proposal
9. Monitoring and Compliance → Ensuring implementation and follow-up on commitments
